clinical_study.brief_title: Chidamide Maintenance After Autologous Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation for Relapsed, Refractory or High-risk Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: Chidamide Maintenance Treatment After Autologous Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation in Patients With Relapsed, Refractory or High-risk Lymphoma : a Prospective, Multi-centric, Single Arm, Open Label Phase II Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Chidamide Maintenance Treatment After Autologous Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation in Patients With Relapsed, Refractory or High-risk Lymphoma : a Prospective, Multi-centric, Single Arm, Open Label Phase II Clinical Trial

detailed_description.textblock: Chidamide，a novel histone deacetylase inhibitor has been approved for the treatment of relapsed or refractory peripheral T-cell lymphoma in China. The aim of this study was to observe the efficacy and safety of Chidamide as Maintenance Treatment After Autologous Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation in Patients With Relapsed, Refractory or High-risk Lymphoma

primary_outcome.description: Time from treatment until disease progression or death

secondary_outcome.description: Time from treatment until death from any cause

intervention.description: Chidamide 20mg orally BIW. Treatment cycles are repeated every 4 weeks.
